name: galloway
content:
Galloway noun
(PLACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an area of southwestern Scotland: They live in the fishing village of Isle of Whithorn, Galloway. The Galloway Forest Park covers around 76,000 hectares of forest, moorland and lochs. See also
Dumfries and Galloway
More examplesFewer examplesHe was raised in Galloway before working as a publisher in America.The island is south of Arran, west of Galloway.The three Galloway villages will forever be associated.

Galloway noun
(COW)
[ C ] a breed of cow kept for its meat: Beef from Galloway cattle is sold in the farm shop. The Galloway breed of cattle became important during the Scoto-Saxon period.
JohnFScott/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesGalloway cows have wide pelvises and calve easily.Two Galloway cows were among a herd of 118 cattle rescued by RSPCA inspectors.Blue Grey is a Whitebred Shorthorn crossed with a Galloway.
